name: Vietnamese Pickled Daikon and Carrots for Banh Mì (Do Chua)
description: The classic sweet and mild crunchy daikon and carrot pickle used to stuff Vietnamese banh mì sandwiches.
totalTime: 10 minutes (for best results, let rest for at least 1 day)
recipeIngredient: 1 large carrot, peeled, cut into strips 1/8th-inch square and 3 inches long (about 2 cups)
1 medium daikon radish, peeled, cut into strips 1/8th-inch square and 3 inches long (about 2 cups)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine carrots, radish, sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Using fingertips, massage salt and sugar into vegetables until dissolved. Add water and rice vinegar. Pack vegetables into a quart-sized mason jar. Pickles can be used immediately, or for best results, seal jar and refrigerate at least overnight and up to 1 week.
